commit_message: Remove hard-coded group column name
Re-add cluster wrapper bash script
Update README.md for group analysis
Remove redundant example file
Merge branch 'groups'
Fix scripts to work with group RGSM IDs
Set e-mail adress in cluster configuration file
Streamline output filenames
Remove shell part of rule: all

Add Java memory parameter for config file

Add a config parameter for Java memory to use for indel realignment and
variant calling.
Update .gitignore with new files
Create example wrapper for cluster submission
Add check for Snakemake success/failure in wrapper
Update example files with per-group functionality
Add per-group config option to cluster wrapper

Change method of merging per-group BAM files

Change the method of mering per-group BAM files to create a temporary
file with a list of all the relevant BAMs and using that for Bamtools,
rather than using direct strings at the command line (as that gave
errors that couldn't be solved).
Fix variant calling rule's shell command
Rename REF variable for clarity
Add required parameter for variant calling script
Add rule for separate indel realignment

Decide per-group analysis on group_col value

Decide the per-group variant calling analysis on the value of the
`group_col` config variable, rather than a separate GROUP variable
(which is not used other than for deciding whether to perform a
per-group analysis anyway).
Update .gitignore to reflect new changes

Separate indel realignment and variant calling

Separate the indel realignment and variant calling scripts into two, to
facilitate the new per-group functionality.

Add functionality for per-group variant calling

Add functionality for performing a per-group variant calling by merging
samples on groups at the variant calling stage.
Change Java Xmx parameter from 7G to 5G
Change chrM to chrMT for snpEff
Add sample-specific variant directories
Add rule priorities
Add bash strict mode for variant calling
Fix minor spelling/wording
Update README.md for the new workflow
Update example config files
Add mail notification upon snakemake completion
Update Snakefile for the new pipeline workflow

Streamline pipeline workflow

Streamline the general pipeline workflow to be more linear, so that expression
estimation is performed directly after downloading, 2-pass alignment is
performed per-sample directly, and so that temporary files are deleted as soon
as they are not needed any more.
Add an example snakemake cluster config file
Add an example of a snakemake config file
Suppress slurm output when working on cluster
Add GEO link to README.md
Fix unspecified parameter in expression rule
Add Snakefile to repo
Merge branch 'fix_download'
Add README.md and LICENCE

Reconfigure .gitignore to be inclusive

Reconfigure the .gitignore file to be inclusive rather than exclusive;
ignore everything except the specified files (.gitignore, config.yaml,
cluster.yaml, submit_snakemake.sh and the scripts/ folder).

Use _1.fastq.gz instead of .fastq_1.gz

Use the standard _1.fastq.gz for raw fastq files instead of the
previously used .fastq_1.gz (a relic from an earlier version of the
pipeline that didn't use an overall workflow loop).
Change rule names in cluster.yaml
Load modules in wrapper script
Rename snakefile to Snakefile

Add functionality to loop through SE/PE samples

Add functionality in the snakemake wrapper to loop through single- and
paired-end samples, one at a time, creating two separate workflows
through the single wrapper.

Add option for expression-only workflow

Add a config option to only perform expression estimations plus
relevant conditionals in rule definitions.
Update cluster.yaml parameters
Update scripts from Uppmax
Update from Uppmax
Update to working version from Uppmax
Fix error in download rule
Fix parameter names in cluster submission wrapper
Add better test metadata and update config.yaml
Streamline cluster.yaml with more default settings
Add --jobs cluster parameter
Add submit_snakemake.sh
Add cluster.yaml
Remove bamtools module from variant_calling script
remove results from .gitignore
Finalise code-in-progress
Rename .tmp to .snake_tmp
Add cleanup of used BAM files
Give logs names based on workflow chronology
Add cleanup of used fastq files
Change variant calling for new framework
Fix alignment pass 2 for new framework
Change alignment pass 1 to new framework

Create new framework for download and expression

Create a new framework for the download and expression steps: the
fastq files to be downloaded are defined with Python in "run:"
statement, which are in turn used as input to the expression rule, which
uses wildcards rather than Python.
Collect layout parameter for rule download
Rename scripts with new ordering
Make expression estimation into separate rule
Add log files to workflow
Fix ambiguity and refactor to give correct output
Make the workflow work in se/pe folders
Make downloading into single-file opertations
Add group to config.yaml
Remove expands from variant calling rule
Fix 04_variant_calling.sh for new framework
Add more cluster parameters to config.yaml

Split alignment into 2 stages and rename files

Split the alignments into 2 stages: one for each passing, using
group-wise junctions in the second stage.
Remove analysis and add results in .gitignore
Fix 02_alignment.sh for new framework
Fix ambiguity and parameters for alignment
Adapt downloading script to new framework

Make inputs depend on specified metadata

Make the input samples/groups/read layouts depend on some columns in the
metadata file, specified in the config.yaml file. This allows for
arbitrary ID types, i.e. it can work for both SRRs and some other file
names, both.
Change directory structure of pipeline
Add config.yaml

Fix snakefile to work with dummy files

Fix the initial snakefile to now work with dummy files and scripts: it
creates empty FASTQ, Kallisto and alignment files based on the library
layout in the metadata file for each SRR id, followed by merging at the
alignment stage and, lastly, variant calling rules.
Add snakefile to repo
Add scripts/ to repo
Add .snakemake, data and analysis to .gitignore
Initial commit
